edu.rit.p3.data

Class BeerJdbcManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.jdbc.support.JdbcAccessor
      • org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate
        • edu.rit.p3.data.BeerJdbcManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean, org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcOperations

    public class BeerJdbcManager
extends org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate

    The instance of BeerJdbcManager serves as the DATA LAYER. This instance is intended to be used by the instance of BeerController (Business Layer) as a way of efficiently and securely interacting with the Beer Database.

    Author:
    Alex Aiezza

      • getUserByUsername

        public User getUserByUsername(java.lang.String username)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException,
                              UserNotFoundException
        Retrieve a user by its username from the database
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user to retrieve
        Returns:
        the user object with the given username
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown when an issue in SQLite or the SQL itself occurs
        UserNotFoundException - Thrown when a username cannot be found in the database

      • getUsers

        public java.util.List<User> getUsers()
        Get all user in the database
        Returns:
        A List of all the users in the database

      • updateUserToken

        public boolean updateUserToken(java.lang.String username,
                               java.lang.String password)
                        throws UserNotFoundException,
                               java.sql.SQLException,
                               UserUnderageException
        Update the authorization token of a user
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user to update the token of
        password - the user's password
        Returns:
        true if the update was successful. false if the user's password is incorrect.
        Throws:
        UserNotFoundException - Thrown if the given username is not found
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown when an issue with SQLite or the SQL itself occurs
        UserUnderageException - Thrown when an underage user attempts to become authorized

      • getTokenByUsername

        public Token getTokenByUsername(java.lang.String username)
                         throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                AuthorizationTokenNotFoundException
        Retrieve the authorization token for a given username
        Parameters:
        username - username to get the token for
        Returns:
        the token of the given username
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown when an issue with SQLite or the SQL itself occurs
        AuthorizationTokenNotFoundException - Thrown when an given username does not have a token

      • getTokenByHash

        public Token getTokenByHash(java.lang.String hash)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException,
                            AuthorizationTokenNotFoundException
        Retrieve the authorization token for a given hash
        Parameters:
        hash - hashcode of the token to look for
        Returns:
        the token with the given hashcode
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown when an issue with SQLite or the SQL itself occurs
        AuthorizationTokenNotFoundException - Thrown when an given hashcode does not have a token

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • updatePriceOfBeer

        public boolean updatePriceOfBeer(java.lang.String beerName,
                                 double price)
                          throws BeerNotFoundException,
                                 java.sql.SQLException
        Update the price of a beer
        Parameters:
        beerName - the name of the beer to change the price of
        price - the new price of the beer
        Returns:
        true if the update was successful. This method in fact does not return false under any circumstance, but if something goes wrong, one of a few exceptions will be thrown.
        Throws:
        BeerNotFoundException - Thrown if the given beer name is not found
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown when an issue MySQL or the SQL itself occurs
